channel.title: Art BTEC?
channel.description:
WTF is it, anyone in ENGLAND whos taken it please explain.
Thanks.

item.title: Art BTEC?
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“gs pk pure, post:11, topic:256673”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=339000.msg2629885#msg2629885 date=1232078709]
BTEC’s tend to be based on practical work or coursework rather than timed examinations. Thus meaning, you would need to produce a portfolio of work opposed to sitting a 2 hour written exam.
[/quote]

Thats not what ive been told, I went to a meeting last Thursday about Diploma’s and BTEC’s and apparently university’s like them i fell asleep for the most part so i cant remember the exact speech[/quote]

Where did i state Universitys didn’t like them?

Read full topic

item.title: Art BTEC?
item.dc:creator: @gs_pk_pure gs pk pure
item.description:
@gs_pk_pure wrote:

Ollie:

BTEC’s tend to be based on practical work or coursework rather than timed examinations. Thus meaning, you would need to produce a portfolio of work opposed to sitting a 2 hour written exam.

Thats not what ive been told, I went to a meeting last Thursday about Diploma’s and BTEC’s and apparently university’s like them i fell asleep for the most part so i cant remember the exact speech

Read full topic

item.title: Art BTEC?
item.dc:creator: @I_Samn_I I Samn I
item.description:

[quote=“Ollie, post:8, topic:256673”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=339000.msg2635163#msg2635163 date=1232470979]
BTEC by Law is the equivilent to a GCSE but there are around 20 “Top” Unis that prefer GCSE’s

Look Here
[/quote]

I couldn’t get into Uni with GCSE’s :([/quote]
owch

item.title: Art BTEC?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Davidude:

I heard BTEC’s don’t look good on university applications. But thats just what I heard, I have no idea what they are.

BTEC by Law is the equivilent to a GCSE but there are around 20 “Top” Unis that prefer GCSE’s

Look Here

Read full topic

item.title: Art BTEC?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Vocational stuff like BTec’s are getting more grunt behind them on Uni apps these days, everyone I know who wanted to go to Uni from my old IT BTec got in. Oxbridge, probably not, but a “normal” uni will be more than willing to credit them.

Read full topic

item.title: Art BTEC?
item.dc:creator: @I_Samn_I I Samn I
item.description:
@I_Samn_I wrote:

Ah thanks for the replies. Tommorow I’ll bother to go see the teacher about it.

Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Art BTEC?
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

As Ollie` said - BTEC’s are based on practical, instead of sitting exams as such you work on a final piece which you are given X amount of hours to complete.

Usually an Art BTEC ( correct me if I’m wrong ) is a double award, so you’d have to dedicate more time and the loss of another subject to take it.

Read full topic
